ratings.comment: He's excellent. Expectations are clear. Material is well explained, and he clearly cares a lot about the subject matter and the students' learning. Exams and lab work were very reasonable and really really interesting.
Amazing class and professor.  Everything covered is interesting and he is so passionate, its contagious!

He is a good professor and does a great job explaining the material.  You must attend every lecture and memorize every little detail to do well on the exams.  Pray your TA isn't Eric...he writes difficult and nitpicky exams.  Exams from previous years were more fair than his.

Awesome professor teaching a sweet class! Super interesting material. Very easy to follow. Would recommend taking an intro micro course before hand... It'll help clarify certain topics. No textbook needed, just attend lecture as exams come straight from class. One of my fave profs and classes at UW!

very interesting lecturer, clear about what will be on exams (which aren't particulary difficult if you attend class). although some concepts are a bit over my head, this course really doesn't warrant its pre-requisites and i would recommend it for any upper-level bio major
He's a fun lecturer, great stories, lots of information, easy to follow.  If you study his online notes and attend class you'll do very well.

I love this guy.  He likes to tell stories to liven things up a little.  It's by far the most awake I've been in an 8:50 class.  The book isn't essential, but I read it before the exams and I think it helped.  And it's pretty good, so I'll be holding onto it.  The exams are easy if you study a little, and the class is really interesting.  Take it!

He's pretty clear on what you need to know for exams and what he's just telling you for fun.  Don't waste your money on the book unless you usually need to read for clarification.  Better yet, go in on one book with a couple people...trust me.  His TA goes fast, so print slides before her lectures.
